title: The challenges and joys of being a Christmas tree farmer in Massachusetts

bullets: Local News Christmas tree season is short, intense, and years in the making.

title: Jaylen Brown, Celtics chip away and rally for impressive win over Pacers: 7 takeaways

title: Wickedpedia: Why is the Green Line so loud?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Wickedpedia Unfortunately, there are a lot of reasons.
An MBTA Green Line train is lit with the brake lights of another train ahead of it on Huntington Avenue.
Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff The Green Line is notorious for its piercing screech — a sound so quintessentially Boston that everyone loves to hate it.

title: Bruins might have to face tough decision about goalie rotation after holidays

bullets: Boston Bruins "Korpi tried everything he possibly could, we just left him hanging a little bit.

title: SJC denies bail for North Andover officer shot by colleague
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Kelsey Fitzsimmons pointed a gun at a fellow officer as colleagues were attempting to serve her a restraining order in June, prosecutors say.
Kelsey Fitzsimmons was sworn in as a North Andover police officer in May 2024.

title: David Pastrnak labels Tuesday’s game vs. Montreal as ‘must-win’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "It's [the] Montreal Canadiens.
It's very, very easy to get motivated, especially the way the last couple games [went].

title: Custom label manufacturer to close Massachusetts plant, lay off nearly 70 workers
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The shutdown is part of a broader wave of manufacturing closures and relocations across the state this year.

A custom label printer in Wilmington is permanently closing, adding to a growing list of Massachusetts manufacturers that have shut down or moved operations elsewhere as the state’s manufacturing footprint continues to shrink.
In a WARN notice on Friday, Smyth Companies announced that the manufacturing plant will “permanently close” beginning March 1, affecting 69 employees.

title: Live-in personal care attendants now exempt from state and federal income taxes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Health The move is projected to save about 18,000 health care professionals $5,000 or more per year.
Personal care attendants who live with the person they assist will no longer be subject to state or federal income taxes, Gov.
Maura Healey announced.

title: Barry Manilow to have surgery for early-stage lung cancer and postpones January concerts
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Entertainment Manilow, 82, said doctors found the cancer after he had an extended bout of bronchitis — six weeks, then a relapse of another five weeks.
Barry Manilow performs during the Pre-Grammy Gala on Feb.
1, 2025, at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, Calif.
